channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Manchester United loses to small soccer club Grimsby Town
item.description: Premier League soccer team Manchester United got demolished by a surprise upset from a much less well-known team: Grimsby Town.

item.title: Introducing 'Sources & Methods,' a new podcast from NPR
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly introduces you to her new national security podcast, Sources & Methods. Each week digs into the biggest national security stories.

item.title: Trump administration argues that more roads would help against wildfires
item.description: The Trump administration is citing wildfire suppression as the reason it's seeking to undo the Roadless Rule. Science suggests more roads will cause more fires.

item.title: Radiohead re-charts on the Billboard Hot 100
item.description: A Radiohead song from the '90s has just made its Billboard chart debut â€” 28 years later.

item.title: NPR exclusive: The role the U.S. has played in the humanitarian crisis in Gaza
item.description: As famine plagues Gaza, NPR exclusive reporting looks at the U.S. role in the humanitarian crisis. Many former officials NPR interviewed share a common refrain: Did we do enough to prevent this?

item.title: In Mississippi, 20 years after Hurricane Katrina, the recovery has been long
item.description: Former Gov. Haley Barbour reflects on the hurricane's blow to Mississippi, where 238 people were killed. He says there are lessons in the resilience of people and the government's disaster response.

item.title: Denmark summons U.S. envoy over claims of interference in Greenland
item.description: Denmark's foreign minister summoned the top U.S. diplomat in the country after it was reported that at least three people with connections to President Trump have been carrying out covert operations.

item.title: Former CDC director weighs in on leadership shakeup
item.description: The White House says CDC Director Susan Monarez was fired because she was not aligned with President Trump's mission to make America healthy again. What does the exodus mean for the agency?

item.title: CDC leaders resign after RFK Jr. moves to fire director Susan Monarez
item.description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention will be facing a huge leadership vacuum, as Director Susan Monarez is forced out by RFK Jr. and the Trump administration.

item.title: New train connects Mississippi towns 20 years after Katrina
item.description: Amtrak just reopened a route from Mobile, Ala., to New Orleans that's connecting communities along the Gulf Coast for the first time since Hurricane Katrina. It's called the Mardi Gras line.
